CreateAccelerationDomain.document: This example shows you how to connect a domain to EdgeOne.
CreateAccelerationDomain.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateAccelerationDomain

{

    "ZoneId": "zone-225qgrnvbi9w",
    "OriginInfo": {
        "OriginType": "ip_domain",
        "Origin": "qq.com",
        "BackupOrigin": ""
    }
}
CreateAccelerationDomain.title: Connecting a domain to EdgeOne

CreateAccelerationDomain.document: This example shows you how to connect a domain u200dto EdgeOne and configure an AWS S3 origin that supports u200dAWS Signature Version 2.
CreateAccelerationDomain.title: Connecting a domain to EdgeOne and configuring AWS Signature Version 2

POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateAliasDomain
<Common request parameters>

{
    "TargetName": "aaa.example.com",
    "AliasName": "bbb.test.com",
    "CertType": "none",
    "ZoneId": "zone-28569s6od5na"
}
CreateAliasDomain.title: Creating an alias domain name

CreateApplicationProxy.document: This example shows you how to create an application proxy.
CreateApplicationProxy.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1 
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com 
Content-Type: application/json 
X-TC-Action: CreateApplicationProxy 
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ZoneId": "zone-21xfqlh4qjee",
    "ProxyName": "instancd-name",
    "ProxyType": "instance",
    "PlatType": "ip",
    "SecurityType": 1,
    "AccelerateType": 1,
    "SessionPersistTime": 3600,
    "Ipv6": {
        "Switch": "on"
    },
    "ApplicationProxyRules": [
        {
            "Proto": "TCP",
            "Port": [
                "80",
                "90",
                "99-110"
            ],
            "OriginType": "custom",
            "OriginValue": [
                "1.1.1.1:80"
            ]
        },
        {
            "Proto": "UDP",
            "Port": [
                "999",
                "888",
                "99-110"
            ],
            "OriginType": "custom",
            "OriginValue": [
                "1.1.1.1:80",
                "2.2.2.2:80"
            ]
        }
    ]
}
CreateApplicationProxy.title: Creating an application proxy

CreateApplicationProxyRule.document: This example shows you how to create an application proxy rule.
CreateApplicationProxyRule.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateApplicationProxyRule
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ZoneId": "zone-21xfqlh4qjee",
    "ProxyId": "proxy-19389e5dwwxfs",
    "Proto": "TCP",
    "Port": [
        "99-110"
    ],
    "OriginType": "custom",
    "OriginValue": [
        "1.1.1.1"
    ],
    "OriginPort": "99-110",
    "ForwardClientIp": "TOA",
    "SessionPersist": false
}
CreateApplicationProxyRule.title: Creating an application proxy rule

CreateOriginGroup.document: In this example, the origin group can be used for layer-4 proxy rules and load balancing. If it is used for layer-4 proxy rules, OriginType must be `self` and a port number must be contained.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a customer origin group that performs origin-pull by weight

CreateOriginGroup.document: In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing and the origin-pull will be performed by round-robin.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a customer origin group that performs origin-pull by weight (default port)

CreateOriginGroup.document: In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a customer origin group that performs origin-pull by protocol (specified protocol and port)

CreateOriginGroup.document: In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a public AWS object storage origin group

CreateOriginGroup.document: In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a private AWS object storage origin group

CreateOriginGroup.document:
In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing.
Note: To give EdgeOne access to COS products, you can complete authorization on the console.
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a public Tencent Cloud COS origin group

CreateOriginGroup.document:
In this example, the origin group can be used for load balancing.
Note: To give EdgeOne access to COS products, you can complete authorization on the console.
CreateOriginGroup.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreateOriginGroup
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ZoneId": "zone-27q0p0bali16",
    "OriginGroupName": "origingroupforloadbalancing",
    "ConfigurationType": "",
    "OriginType": "cos",
    "OriginRecords": [
        {
            "Record": "your-name.cos.ap-nanjing.myqcloud.com",
            "Private": true
        }
    ]
}
CreateOriginGroup.title: Creating a private Tencent Cloud COS origin group

CreatePrefetchTask.document: The example shows you how to submit a pre-warming task.
CreatePrefetchTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1 
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com 
Content-Type: application/json 
X-TC-Action: CreatePrefetchTask 
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "http://www.qq.com/a.txt"
    ],
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew",
    "EncodeUrl": true
}
CreatePrefetchTask.title: Pre-warming a URL

CreatePurgeTask.document:
By using Invalidate method, resources under a site are associated with tags in the HTTP response header Cache-Tag and marked as invalid.
This example shows you how to purge resources that contain tag1, tag2 and tag3 and have changed under the site example.com.
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "tag1",
        "tag2",
        "tag3"
    ],
    "Type": "purge_cache_tag",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Purging by the Cache-Tag

CreatePurgeTask.document:
By using Invalidate method, resources under a domain name that matches the specified hostname are marked as invalid. This example shows you how to purge resources changed under the site domain www.example.com.
  • Note: Domain names cannot include wildcards (*).
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "www.example.com"
    ],
    "Type": "purge_host",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Purging by the hostname

CreatePurgeTask.document:
By using Delete method, resources under a URL that matches the specified hostname are removed.
This example shows you how to purge resources in the directory /a.txt under the site domain www.example.com.
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "http://www.example.com/a.txt"
    ],
    "Type": "purge_url",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Purging by the URL

CreatePurgeTask.document:
By using Invalidate method, all cached resources under a site are marked as invalid.
This example shows you how to purge all cached resources changed under the site example.com.
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Type": "purge_all",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Purging all caches under a site

CreatePurgeTask.document:
To purge the resources updated under a directory, pass `invalidate` into the Method field.
This example shows you how to purge resources changed in the directory /test under the site domain www.example.com.
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "http://www.example.com/test/"
    ],
    "Type": "purge_prefix",
    "Method": "invalidate",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Only purging resources updated in the directory

CreatePurgeTask.document:
To purge all resources under u200da directory, pass `delete` into the Method field.
This example shows you how to purge all resources in the /test directory under www.example.com.
CreatePurgeTask.input:
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-TC-Action: CreatePurgeTask
<Common request parameters>

{
    "Targets": [
        "http://www.example.com/test/"
    ],
    "Type": "purge_prefix",
    "Method": "delete",
    "ZoneId": "zone-ajj243dwrew"
}
CreatePurgeTask.title: Purging by the directory â€“ Deleting resources in the directory

    "ZoneId": "zone-20hyebgyfsko",
    "Limit": 0,
    "Filters": [
        {
            "Fuzzy": true,
            "Values": [
                "domain-3d5dg39c"
            ],
            "Name": "domain-id"

    "Offset": 0,
    "Order": "created_on",
    "Match": "all"
}

ModifyApplicationProxy.document: This example shows you how to modify an application proxy.

POST / HTTP/1.1 
Host: teo.tencentcloudapi.com 
Content-Type: application/json 
X-TC-Action: ModifyApplicationProxy 
<Common request parameters>

{
    "ZoneId": "zone-21xfqlh4qjee",
    "ProxyId": "proxy-537f5b41-162a-11ed-abaa-525400c5da15",
    "ProxyName": "test.com",
    "ProxyType": "hostname",
    "SessionPersistTime": 3600,
    "Ipv6": {
        "Switch": "on"
    }
}
ModifyApplicationProxy.title: Modifying an application proxy

    "ZoneId": "zone-276zs184g93m",
    "ProxyId": "proxy-19389e5dwwxfs",
    "RuleId": "rule-5e0a2b4e-df6d-4d2a-ac39-1706cbf8a707",
    "Proto": "TCP",
    "Port": [
        "99-110"
    ],
    "OriginType": "custom",
    "OriginValue": [
        "1.1.1.1"
    ],
    "OriginPort": "99-110",
    "ForwardClientIp": "TOA",
    "SessionPersist": false
}
